description: From Middle English medlere, medelere, equivalent to meddle +‎ -er.

entries.meaning: One who meddles or interferes in something not of their concern.
examples: “Yes, Mr. Coleman, I have,” answered Luke steadily. “I thought it my duty to inform this man of your character. I have advised him to put his money into a savings-bank.”
“Curse you for an impertinent meddler!” said Coleman wrathfully. “I’ll get even with you for this!”
“You can do as you please,” said Luke calmly.
